name: Bali Dynasty Resort

reviews.text: Stayed here as it was recommended as a gret hotel in Kuta, generally good services but being put in an old room at same price as new renovated room was a bit dissapointing. Pool areas are nice with a great kids free area but couldn't get to the beach without running the gauntlet of street traders in the back alley - a better access to the beach realy is needed. The breakfast was great but the 'theme' dinners were very overpriced and pretty average - better to go out and discover the town.
reviews.title: Great for families

reviews.text: just had a 2 week stay at dynasty , week one in interconnecting delux pool view rooms with my 14 &11 old kids and my friend and her 10 & 9 yaers old. we had the best of both worlds as we spent the first week shopping and relaxing, then the second week our husbands arrived and we moved to bigger rooms and did all the touristy stuff.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel, we loved it !

reviews.text: the second week i had a delux pool view family room booked, but the hotel needed my room so offered me an upgrade for half the cost it would normally be to go to an executive suite. very very nice. i had wanted this room initially but was told it was only for kids12 years and under, but since they wanted my room i got it. the bed just fitted my daughter but if she was a sleeper who stretched out it may have been a problem.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: my friends went into a kids suite, there is no point telling you about since they have now closed them off to renovate them, they did tell me though that the new kids suite will have no age limit on them as the beds are bigger as in the family suites and they will have a trundle therefore sleeping upto 5 of any age.
reviews.title: Good family hotel - however is undergoing major renovations beginning of 2010

reviews.text: The hotel
reviews.title: Fantastic place for a holiday

reviews.text: We have just returned from a 6 night stay at Bali Dynasty Hotel. We travelled with our 2 sons aged 10 & 7 and stayed in a Kids Suite. This was my 10th trip to Bali and I have stayed somewhere new each time. Bali Dynasty would have to be the nicest hotel Ive stayed at so far. The room was beautiful, I couldnt find fault with anything. It was very spacious and had a dividing door between us & the kids which was great at night when they went to bed, we could close the door and watch TV without keeping them awake. The room had 2 flat screen TV's, DVD player & Playstation with games. The bath towels were thick & white, the beds were huge and comfortable, with thick comfy pillows. The decor was modern & bright. The room had a small fridge, kettle, glasses, coffee cups, tea, coffee & sugar. Bottled water was provided each day for free. There was a large wardrobe and plenty of draw space for our clothes. We were on the ground floor overlooking the garden and it was so quiet, there was no noise from surrounding rooms. The airconditioning was perfect, not too cold and very quiet. The rooms were so clean and I didnt need to light mossie coils at night as there were none in the room.
reviews.title: Great Family Hotel - highly recommend it

reviews.text: After reading other reviews, I had expected the pool area to be noisy and full of roudy aussies. It wasnt anything like that while we were there. The hotel was full during our stay, yet there was always plenty of deck chairs around the pool and never over crowded in the pool itself. The kids pool was great with a huge water slide. We would lay by the pool, while our 2 boys went up & down the slide for hours, it was well supervised by pool staff and they intereacted well with all the children. They have happy hour at the pool bar twice a day and drinks are quite reasonable at regular prices. The food at the pool bar is good too & reasonably priced. Pool towels were readily available & always clean.
reviews.title: The best family hotel I have ever stayed at

reviews.text: We didnt buy breakfast with our hotel package as I thought it was expensive, but we ate at Daddys Cafe directly opposite each morning for approx $20 for 4 of us.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel - couldnt find any faults except it was packed!

reviews.text: We used the hotel internet & laundry service, I couldnt fault either of them. Hotel staff were always friendly & courteous. Our room was thorougly cleaned by lunchtime each day and the hotel grounds are lush & well maintained. There is security screening each time you enter the hotel at the front gate.
reviews.title: Had our Dream Wedding Here

reviews.text: My husband used the gym everyday and said it had great equipment and was very clean.
reviews.title: Better than I could ever have imagined.

reviews.text: stayed at bali dynasty for 8 nights for our 1st bali trip and loved every minute. staff and facilities are excellent. loved the pools especially the love buckets at happy hour (good value). our room was a renovated one and very clean and comfortable. would highly recommend especially for families with children.
reviews.title: excellent location and facilities

reviews.text: It was a lovely family hotel. With lovely pools and a great slide for the kids. We found it was very clean and friendly staff. They also have very good security and you feel very safe.There is also a kids club for the kids and activities in the pool through out the day that anyone can do. They also have great restraunts down stairs with lovely fresh food. I would advise any one that is going to bali to stay here.
reviews.title: Great Resort for Families

reviews.text: chloe age 10 wollongong
reviews.title: it all depends

reviews.text: Front office service are friendly and helpful, they smile and greet to almost everyone. Restaurant waitress and waiter serve only to White Skin Foreigners. When they see a white skin foreigners, they approach and serve them, not to other coloured skin. This goes to the Massage Service Girl! Not recommended if you want peace/relax beach. Too many children, overal building is wearing out! No sound proof at all, could hear outside sound easily. The best point is Excellent Location!!
reviews.title: Loved the atmosphere around the pool

reviews.text: This was the second time i have stayed at the Bali Dynasty, and it lived up to my expectations once again. There was a group of 8 of us staying in 4 superior rooms. All the rooms were clean and comfortable and had great air con, which we definately needed for that time of year. There was activities on at the pool and around the resort everyday. The hotel is very kid friendly, so if this isn't what your after I'd probably suggest staying somewhere else, even though i didnt travel with any kids. The deluxe rooms are all new and refurbed and i believe the superior rooms are next and i agree that it will be a great improvement. I think i'd like to try somewhere else next time, but will definately recommend this to friends, as the location is great, theres restaurants on site and just a short walk out to the main road. an excellent money changer at the kodak shop next door. discovery mall just a stroll down the road with the waterbom park close by. 15 minutes from the airport. 5 minutes taxi to Kuta Square. perfect!
reviews.title: Good facilities
"Lost it's Shine!"Despite the renovations, still Very Dissapointing!
reviews.text: We have stayed in this hotels many times before and we left this time very dissapointed and very surprised in the declining standards of the hotel and staff.

reviews.title: Sooo Crowded!!
reviews.text: Yes the hotel is undergoing renovations, which are being well handled and are not too annoying so it's not that aspect. It's the way things are being done now.
Don' get me wrong, some people will stick to ths hotel like glue because there is no better on offer in terms of family rooms and facilities for kids, it's the quality that has gone down the tube!
reviews.title: Once again terrific

reviews.text: For starters, It stinks, literally, like raw sewage, which is exactly what it is. Our friends room smelled like a septic tank and were forced to move. Other people were being moved daily due to the sewage issue. you could see people constantly standing outside their rooms waiting for engineers to check the problems. The smell was ungodly!
reviews.title: New rooms great but pool area nothing to rave about

reviews.text: The grounds also smell like sewage in certain parts.
reviews.title: Great service, great atmosphere, great hotel

description: Bali Dynasty Resort is a premier beachside resort in South Kuta, renowned for its warm Balinese hospitality. The property offers six restaurants, five bars, three swimming pools, a comprehensive spa, exercise room, beach club, kids and teens club, meeting facilities and a complimentary Hospitality Lounge for those early arrivals and late departures.The unique layout allows for a subtle but effective division between the couples market and the family market. Couples can enjoy the famous Gracie Kelly's Irish Pub and relax at the adults-only Lazy Pool. Kids can enjoy the Kids Water Fun Zone and a 56-metre waterslide flowing into their own pool adjacent to which lies the Enchanted Garden Kids’ Club. A wide variety of rooms catering to the family market are available, sleeping up to five people.The resort is conveniently located within ten minutes drive from the airport on the vibrant South Kuta Beach strip. It is within walking distance to the shopping centre and mall, art markets, Waterbom Park and an extensive choice of restaurants, nightspots and entertainment venues.
